intro: Biscutella varia, commonly known as the variable biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with small, basal leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Biscutella varia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
